column4: hi all.  Anyone know how to reinstall ethernet drivers from the command line?
most "ethernet" drivers are in the kernel.  what are you trying to do?  you can use ifconfig to configure an ethernet card from cli.
could you pastebin the output of "lspci | grep Ethernet"
you might want to see if this applies (looks like you have an "odd" ethernet controller there) http://www.question-defense.com/2010/06/03/ubuntu-10-4-eth0-not-available-rtl-81398139c8139c-rev-10
